guide.introduction:
This guide will teach you how to make your very own EZ-EL Wire bicycle! For more cool ideas check out https://ez-el.com/tutorials!

The EZ-EL Wire Kit you will need for this project can be purchased here.

Enter coupon code MAKEbike at checkout for a discount!
guide.introduction_rendered:
This guide will teach you how to make your very own EZ-EL Wire bicycle! For more cool ideas check out https://ez-el.com/tutorials!

The EZ-EL Wire Kit you will need for this project can be purchased here.

Enter coupon code MAKEbike at checkout for a discount!

Relevant parts
  • 10' Blue EZ-EL Wire Kit
  • 25' Blue EZ-EL Wire Kit
  • 10' White EZ-EL Wire Kit
  • Tape
  • Zip ties
Tools
  • Wire cutter

lines.text: Here is what the finished bike will look like.
lines.text_raw: Here is what the finished bike will look like.

lines.text: For this particular design, the front wheel has a square design and the back wheel has a weaving design within the spokes of the wheel. You can create your own designs for your bike's wheels.
lines.text_raw: For this particular design, the front wheel has a square design and the back wheel has a weaving design within the spokes of the wheel. You can create your own designs for your bike's wheels.

lines.text: After you've created your designs, attach the extension cable to the inverter and secure the inverter in the center of the wheel. This will be your starting point.
lines.text_raw: After you've created your designs, attach the extension cable to the inverter and secure the inverter in the center of the wheel. This will be your starting point.

lines.text: Let the extension cable reach the rim of the wheel and start following your pattern from your design.
lines.text_raw: Let the extension cable reach the rim of the wheel and start following your pattern from your design.

lines.text: For this weaving design, insert the 25' Blue EL Wire through each spoke of the wheel, creating a continuous "S" design throughout the circumference of the wheel.
lines.text_raw: For this weaving design, insert the 25' Blue EL Wire through each spoke of the wheel, creating a continuous "S" design throughout the circumference of the wheel.

lines.text: When the first weave reaches full circle, start weaving the same wire in an opposite "S" direction between of each spoke of the wheel to achieve the "weave" effect.
lines.text_raw: When the first weave reaches full circle, start weaving the same wire in an opposite "S" direction between of each spoke of the wheel to achieve the "weave" effect.

lines.text: When the second weave reaches full circle again, use a wire cutter to snip off the excess wire.
lines.text_raw: When the second weave reaches full circle again, use a wire cutter to snip off the excess wire.

lines.text: Zip tie or tape down the end of the wire to the bike.
lines.text_raw: Zip tie or tape down the end of the wire to the bike.

lines.text: As with the circle design, start the pattern with the inverter attached to the extension cable and secure the inverter to the center of the wheel.
lines.text_raw: As with the circle design, start the pattern with the inverter attached to the extension cable and secure the inverter to the center of the wheel.

lines.text: Let the extension cable reach the rim of the wheel and start your design.
lines.text_raw: Let the extension cable reach the rim of the wheel and start your design.

lines.text: For this square design, extend the 10' wire to form the 1st corner of the square.
lines.text_raw: For this square design, extend the 10' wire to form the 1st corner of the square.

lines.text: Use a zip tie to secure the corner at a 90-degree angle.
lines.text_raw: Use a zip tie to secure the corner at a 90-degree angle.

lines.text: Continue this process until the square is complete with the wire ending where it began, resulting in a square shape.
lines.text_raw: Continue this process until the square is complete with the wire ending where it began, resulting in a square shape.

lines.text: Snip off the excess wire with a wire cutter.
lines.text_raw: Snip off the excess wire with a wire cutter.

lines.text: Zip tie or tape down the end of the wire to the bike.
lines.text_raw: Zip tie or tape down the end of the wire to the bike.

lines.text: Outline the body of the bike with another 10' White EL wire. Use zip ties to secure the wire to the bike.
lines.text_raw: Outline the body of the bike with another 10' White EL wire. Use zip ties to secure the wire to the bike.

lines.text: Connect the inverter to the wire and use zip ties to secure the inverter underneath the frame of the bike.
lines.text_raw: Connect the inverter to the wire and use zip ties to secure the inverter underneath the frame of the bike.

lines.text: Snip off excess wire when you're done with the design.
lines.text_raw: Snip off excess wire when you're done with the design.

lines.text: Zip tie or tape down the end of the wire to the bike.
lines.text_raw: Zip tie or tape down the end of the wire to the bike.

lines.text: Enjoy your awesome bike! Take it out for a midnight ride or bike party!
lines.text_raw: Enjoy your awesome bike! Take it out for a midnight ride or bike party!

guide.summary: Deck out a bicycle with EZ-EL Wire! Looks great at night, and adds to rider safety by increasing visibility.
